points: Built from a 1997 Polish autoresponder to a platform serving 350k+ customers in 183 countries (2025 review).
Email marketing software market growing from $1.38B in 2023 to $3.73B by 2032 (11.8% CAGR).
Founder Simon Grabowski lacked simple, affordable automation tools and built his own autoresponder in Poland.
Mission: tailor easy email marketing for businesses that needed automation without heavy stacks.
Registered getresponse.com in 1998 to launch the autoresponder as a product.
Early product delivered autoresponders and newsletters as the core experience.
Hit 300k customers by 2013 (official timeline).
By 2025 review, 350k+ customers across 183 countries, showing continued adoption.
Bundles automation, landing pages/websites, and webinars instead of email-only tooling.
Combines capture (landing pages), nurture (autoresponders), and live engagement (webinars).
Recap: Polish founder-built autoresponder grew into a 350k-customer platform with bundled growth tools.
Paid part will cover plan selection, practical setups, and when to choose GetResponse vs rivals.
Pick Free (2,500 sends) or Starter/Marketer/Creator based on list size and automation depth.
Set up autoresponders, landing pages, and webinars as a unified funnel for capture→nurture→conversion.
Use built-in website/landing tools to avoid extra hosting while testing campaigns.
SMBs and creators leverage automation plus webinars to onboard and sell without separate webinar software.
Global reach (183 countries) suggests multi-language campaigns; use localized pages and sends.
Mailchimp: strong templates; GetResponse differentiates with webinars and automation bundles.
ActiveCampaign: deep automation/CRM; GetResponse offers integrated pages and webinars at lower entry price.
Brevo (Sendinblue): low-cost email/SMS; GetResponse suits when webinars and landing sites are needed.
Match contact count to plan thresholds (1,000 subscribers at $19 Starter; 2,500 sends free plan).
Account for bundled tools replacing standalone landing page or webinar software in cost calculations.
Enterprise Max starts around $1,099/month; assess migration/onboarding support needs.
Checklist: choose plan by list size, connect landing pages/webinars, set autoresponders, compare with competitors.
When GetResponse wins: needing bundled webinars/automation; when rivals win: specialized CRM depth or SMS focus.
